paper_abstract: The notion of a grid holey packing (GHP) was first proposed for the construction of constant composite codes. For a GHP (k, 1; n x g) of type [w(1), ... , w(g)], where k = Sigma(g)(j=1) w(j), the fundamental problem is to determine the packing number N([w(1), ... , w(g)], 1; n x g), that is, the maximum number of blocks in such a GHP. In this paper we determine completely the values of N([w(1), ... , w(g)], 1; n x g) in the case of block size k is an element of {3, 4}.
paper_title: Optimal grid holey packings with block size 3 and 4
